contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Map.Joboji-Town.Iwate.PNG|thumb|Map of Jōbōji, Iwate]] {{Nihongo|'''Jōbōji'''|浄法寺町|''Jōbōji-machi''}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ninohe District, Iwate|Ninohe District]], [[Iwate Prefecture|Iwate]], [[Japan]]. It merged into the city of [[Ninohe, Iwate|Ninohe]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 5,130 and a [[population density|density]] of 28.55 persons per km². The total area was 179.70 km². On January 1, 2006, the existing city of Ninohe merged with the neighboring town of Jōbōji and formed a new city still named Ninohe. The new city's population is estimated (based on data from 2000) to be 33,102, with a total area of 420.31 km². The town itself was quite small and while it is home to both a library and an indoor basketball court the range of facilities present are very limited. {{DEFAULTSORT:Joboji, Iwate}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Iwate Prefecture]] {{Iwate-geo-stub}}
